Name: String of faience and carnelian beads
Description: String of shell disk beads, from the robbed burial of a child, beneath a large offering-chapel at Abydos ('Mastaba I'). The burial was in the upper chamber to the south, one of four cut from a shaft beneath the chapel. Another shaft had been cut for another set of burials beneath the same chapel. The robbers did not remove these beads, or the shell beads NMI 1912:189. The group can be dated to the 12th Dynasty.
